action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: car, egypt, lap, pipe, teacher, robin, triangle, comic, duck.
Your opponent's team words are: suit, battery, snowman, doctor, light, state, charge, penguin.
Distractor words are: copper, hand, bear, kangaroo, band, knight, arm.
The kill words are: water.
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. I need to come up with a single-word clue that relates to some of my team's words: car, egypt, lap, pipe, teacher, robin, triangle, comic, duck. The clue can't be one of the words themselves or part of them. Also, I have to avoid the opponent's words and the distractors. The kill word is water, so I need to make sure my clue doesn't accidentally relate to that.

First, let me list out the team words again to see if there's a common theme or something they all connect to. Car, Egypt, lap, pipe, teacher, robin, triangle, comic, duck. Hmm. Let's think about each one. 

Car: maybe related to race? Like a race car. But then lap is part of a race. Egypt is a country, maybe related to pharaohs or pyramids. Pipe could be part of a plumbing system or a musical instrument. Teacher is an occupation. Robin could be the bird or the superhero. Triangle is a shape. Comic is like a comic book. Duck is a bird. 

Looking for a common link. Maybe "race"? Because car, lap (as in race lap), and maybe even duck (like a duck race)? But does that connect to the others? Egypt might not fit. Teacher? Not sure. Pipe? Maybe not. 

Another angle: "comic" and "teacher" could be related to
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
